ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Deepened my knowledge of Italian, especially in terms of grammar
Italian language and culture.
I further developed my Italian grammar and vocabulary skills while deepening my knowledge of history and culture.
Deepened my italian vocab and grammar
My knowledge of Italian as a whole improved, especially in relation to my ability to read and understand both modern and historical literary works.
Ability to speak fluent Italian

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Simona is amazing and L4 was the most fun of any Italian course I've taken, since you start to engage more with the language (reading, writing, speaking, watching movies) and focus less on learning the basics at this level 
No weaknesses!
The course was fun and engaging. The professor was also very kind. No immediate weaknesses come to mind.

The class activities are great because of the ability to connect with classmates and learn more about Italy while practicing the language. I think that the asynchronous activities could be more engaging, perhaps with more explorations of Italian culture like history and music.

strengths: small class size and engaging prof. practiced a lot of conversations which helped immensely with conversational fluency
weaknesses: course overall seemed too by the book and a race to finish the textbook as opposed to giving space and time to internalize the material. could have benefitted from more creative projects

This course was well-designed to facilitate communication with other students during class, although at times was overly stringent in terms of expectations regarding what material was learned and when.
Lots of group discussion

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes!! If you took L13 for the language requirement and are even considering continuing with the language, do it!! I definitely feel more confident about my Italian skills coming out of L4, and the class was so much more relaxed and fun than the lower levels. It's also really nice being in a class where everyone is choosing to take it, rather than taking it because they have to  great energy every day.
I would, I enjoyed the class a lot and felt like I picked up the Italian language quickly.
Yes, if interested in continuing in the language.
Yes anyone wanting to learn Italian
Yes! Simona is a fantastic instructor and the class was challenging yet fun!

This is a great course, especially with Simona! You will continue improving your Italian skills in a low-stress environment. This class is similar to L3 and is mainly review of topics already learned in L2 with more in-depth study. You will also get to learn about Italian culture through music, poetry, and movies.
yes ofc!!
Any student who wants to increase their fluency in Italian should take this course.
Yes
